name: mcu-debug
description: A debugger and debug adapter for MCUs
author: Haneef Mohammed <haneefdm@gmail.com>

mcu-debug.enableTelemetry.description: Enable Telemetry for the Mcu-Debug Extension.

mcu-debug.dbgServerLogfile.description: Logs the contents of the gdb-server terminal. Use ${PID} in the file name to make it unique per VSCode session

mcu-debug.armToolchainPath.description: Path to the ARM Toolchain. If not set, the extension will look in the system path.

mcu-debug.armToolchainPath.linux.description: Path to the ARM Toolchain. If not set, the extension will look in the system path.

mcu-debug.armToolchainPath.osx.description: Path to the ARM Toolchain. If not set, the extension will look in the system path.

mcu-debug.armToolchainPath.windows.description: Path to the ARM Toolchain. If not set, the extension will look in the system path.

mcu-debug.gdbPath.description: Path to the GDB executable. If not set, the extension will look in the system path.

mcu-debug.gdbPath.linux.description: Path to the GDB executable. If not set, the extension will look in the system path.

mcu-debug.gdbPath.osx.description: Path to the GDB executable. If not set, the extension will look in the system path.

mcu-debug.gdbPath.windows.description: Path to the GDB executable. If not set, the extension will look in the system path.

mcu-debug.objdumpPath.description: Path to the objdump executable. If not set, the extension will look in the system path.

mcu-debug.objdumpPath.linux.description: Path to the objdump executable. If not set, the extension will look in the system path.

mcu-debug.objdumpPath.osx.description: Path to the objdump executable. If not set, the extension will look in the system path.

mcu-debug.objdumpPath.windows.description: Path to the objdump executable. If not set, the extension will look in the system path.

mcu-debug.jlinkGDBServerPath.description: Path to the J-Link GDB Server. If not set, the extension will look in the system path.

mcu-debug.jlinkGDBServerPath.linux.description: Path to the J-Link GDB Server. If not set, the extension will look in the system path.

mcu-debug.jlinkGDBServerPath.osx.description: Path to the J-Link GDB Server. If not set, the extension will look in the system path.

mcu-debug.jlinkGDBServerPath.windows.description: Path to the J-Link GDB Server. If not set, the extension will look in the system path.

mcu-debug.openocdPath.description: Path to the OpenOCD executable. If not set, the extension will look in the system path.

mcu-debug.openocdPath.linux.description: Path to the OpenOCD executable. If not set, the extension will look in the system path.

mcu-debug.openocdPath.osx.description: Path to the OpenOCD executable. If not set, the extension will look in the system path.

mcu-debug.openocdPath.windows.description: Path to the OpenOCD executable. If not set, the extension will look in the system path.

mcu-debug.pyocdPath.description: Path to the PyOCD executable. If not set, the extension will look in the system path.

mcu-debug.pyocdPath.linux.description: Path to the PyOCD executable. If not set, the extension will look in the system path.

mcu-debug.pyocdPath.osx.description: Path to the PyOCD executable. If not set, the extension will look in the system path.

mcu-debug.pyocdPath.windows.description: Path to the PyOCD executable. If not set, the extension will look in the system path.

mcu-debug.stlinkPath.description: Path to the ST-Link GDB Server. If not set, the extension will look in the system path.

mcu-debug.stlinkPath.linux.description: Path to the ST-Link GDB Server. If not set, the extension will look in the system path.

mcu-debug.stlinkPath.osx.description: Path to the ST-Link GDB Server. If not set, the extension will look in the system path.

mcu-debug.stlinkPath.windows.description: Path to the ST-Link GDB Server. If not set, the extension will look in the system path.

mcu-debug.stutilPath.description: Path to the ST-Util GDB Server. If not set, the extension will look in the system path.

mcu-debug.stutilPath.linux.description: Path to the ST-Util GDB Server. If not set, the extension will look in the system path.

mcu-debug.stutilPath.osx.description: Path to the ST-Util GDB Server. If not set, the extension will look in the system path.

mcu-debug.stutilPath.windows.description: Path to the ST-Util GDB Server. If not set, the extension will look in the system path.

mcu-debug.PEGDBServerPath.description: Path to the PE Micro GDB Server. If not set, the extension will look in the system path.

mcu-debug.PEGDBServerPath.linux.description: Path to the PE Micro GDB Server. If not set, the extension will look in the system path.

mcu-debug.PEGDBServerPath.osx.description: Path to the PE Micro GDB Server. If not set, the extension will look in the system path.

mcu-debug.PEGDBServerPath.windows.description: Path to the PE Micro GDB Server. If not set, the extension will look in the system path.

commands.title: Toggle hex display in Variables window
Add expression to Live Watch window

servertype.description: GDB Server type - supported types are jlink, openocd, pyocd, pe, stlink, stutil, qemu, bmp and external. For "external", [please read our Wiki](https://github.com/mcu-debug/mcu-debug/wiki/External-gdb-server-configuration). The executable in your PATH is used by default, to override this use serverpath.

debuggerArgs.description: Additional arguments to pass to GDB command line

preLaunchCommands.description: Additional GDB Commands to be executed at the start of the main launch sequence (immediately after attaching to target).

postLaunchCommands.description: Additional GDB Commands to be executed after the main launch sequence has finished.

preAttachCommands.description: Additional GDB Commands to be executed at the start of the main attach sequence (immediately after attaching to target).

postAttachCommands.description: Additional GDB Commands to be executed after the main attach sequence has finished.

preResetCommands.description: Commands to be executed prior to a Reset operation, before the reset is sent to the target.

postResetCommands.description: Commands to be executed after a Reset operation, after the reset is sent to the target.

postRestartCommands.description: Deprecated: Restart is now handled by VSCode. Change to postResetCommands if you use the Reset button.
postRestartCommands.deprecationMessage: Restart is now handled by VSCode. Change to postResetCommands if you use the Reset button.

overrideLaunchCommands.description: Override the commands that are normally executed as part of flashing and launching the target.

overrideAttachCommands.description: Override the commands that are normally executed as part of attaching to a running target.

overrideRestartCommands.description: Deprecated: Restart is now handled by VSCode. Change to overrideResetCommands if you use the Reset button.
overrideRestartCommands.deprecationMessage: Restart is now handled by VSCode. Change to overrideResetCommands if you use the Reset button.

overrideResetCommands.description: Override the commands that are normally executed as part of reset-ing the target.

postStartSessionCommands.description: Additional GDB Commands to be executed at the end of the start sequence, after a debug session has already started and runToEntryPoint is not specified.

postResetSessionCommands.description: Additional GDB Commands to be executed at the end of the reset sequence

postRestartSessionCommands.description: Deprecated: Restart is now handled by VSCode and it is the same as Start. If you are using the Reset button, use postResetSessionCommands instead
postRestartSessionCommands.deprecationMessage: Restart is now handled by VSCode and it is the same as Start. If you are using the Reset button, use postResetSessionCommands instead

overridePreEndSessionCommands.description: Override the commands that are normally executed at the start of ending a debug session (e.g. when stopping debugging).

overrideGDBServerStartedRegex.description: You can supply a regular expression to override the output from the GDB Server that is looked for to determine if the GDB Server has started.

cpu.description: CPU Type Selection - used for QEMU server type

machine.description: Machine Type Selection - used for QEMU server type

rtos.description: RTOS being used. For JLink this can be Azure, ChibiOS, embOS, FreeRTOS, NuttX, Zephyr or the path to a custom JLink RTOS Plugin library. For OpenOCD this can be auto (recommended), FreeRTOS, ThreadX, chibios, Chromium-EC, eCos, embKernel, linux, mqx, nuttx, RIOT, uCOS-III, or Zephyr.

armToolchainPath.description: This setting can be used to override the armToolchainPath user setting for a particular launch configuration.

toolchainPrefix.description: This setting can be used to override the toolchainPrefix user setting for a particular launch configuration. Default = "arm-none-eabi"

serverpath.description: This setting can be used to override the GDB Server path user/workspace setting for a particular launch configuration.

gdbPath.description: This setting can be used to override the GDB path user/workspace setting for a particular launch configuration.

objdumpPath.description: This setting can be used to override the objdump path user/workspace setting for a particular launch configuration.

serverArgs.description: Additional arguments to pass to GDB Server command line

executable.description: Path of executable for symbols and program information. See also `loadFiles`, `symbolFiles`

loadFiles.description: List of files (hex/bin/elf files) to load/program instead of the executable file.

symbolFiles.description: Array of ELF files to load symbols from instead of the executable file.

file.description: Pathname of an ELF file for symbols

offset.description: Optional offset to apply to all sections of the ELF file.

textaddress.description: Optional: Load the TEXT section at the specified 'textaddress'.

gdbInterruptMode.description: Whether GDB shall be interrupted using "exec-interrupt" (default) or by signaling "SIGINT"

gdbTarget.description: For externally (servertype = "external") controlled GDB Servers you must specify the GDB target to connect to.

breakAfterReset.description: Applies to Restart/Reset/Launch, halt debugger after a reset. Ignored if `runToEntryPoint` is used.

runToEntryPoint.description: Applies to Launch/Restart/Reset, ignored for Attach. If enabled the debugger will run until the start of the given function.

numberOfProcessors.description: Number of processors/cores in the target device.

targetProcessor.description: The processor you want to debug. Zero based integer index. Must be less than 'numberOfProcessors'

hardwareBreakpoints.description: WARNING: Force only HW breakpoints to be used.

require.description: If true, forces the use of hardware breakpoints

limit.description: If limit > 0, enforce a limit on the number of hardware breakpoints that can be used

hardwareWatchpoints.description: WARNING: Force only HW watchpoints to be used.

require.description: If true, forces the use of hardware watchpoints

limit.description: If limit > 0, enforce a limit on the number of hardware watchpoints that can be used

liveWatch.description: An object with parameters for Live Watch

enabled.description: Enable/Disable Live Watch. Only applies to OpenOCD

samplesPerSecond.description: Maximum number of samples per second.

chainedConfigurations.description: An object describing how additional configurations should be launched

enabled.description: Enable/Disable entire set of chained configurations

overrides.description: Values to override/set in this child configuration.

inherits.description: List of properties to inherit from parent.

folder.description: Folder to use for this configuration.

overrides.description: Values to override/set in this child configuration.

inherits.description: List of properties to inherit from parent.

launches.name: use EXACT name of chained configuration to launch
launches.folder: use full path or folder basename or leave empty

graphConfig.description: Description of how graphing can be done.

graphId.description: Graph Data Source Id for the plot.

label.description: A label for this data set

timespan.description: Length of time (seconds) to be plotted on screen.
The amount of time (seconds) that the XY Plot will show the trace for.

xGraphId.description: Graph Data Source Id for the X axis

yGraphId.description: Graph Data Source Id Port for the Y axis

showDevDebugOutput.description: Deprecated: Use debugFlags instead. Used to debug this extension.
showDevDebugOutput.deprecationMessage: Please use 'debugFlags' to set individual debug modes.

showDevDebugTimestamps.description: Deprecated: Use debugFlags instead. Show timestamps when 'showDevDebugOutput' is enabled
showDevDebugTimestamps.deprecationMessage: Please use 'debugFlags' to set individual debug modes.

debugFlags.description: Debug flags to debug this extension (mcu-debug); Causes additional output in Debug Console.

gdbTraces.description: Enable GDB MI trace output. Copy/Paste friendly.

liveGdbTraces.description: Enable live GDB MI trace output during polling (only applies to built-in liveWatch/RTT). Can be super verbose.

gdbTracesParsed.description: Enable parsed GDB MI output. NOT Copy/Paste friendly.

debugDisassembly.description: Show debug output from disassembly operations

pathResolution.description: Show path resolution when reading symbols

disableGdbTimeouts.description: Disable GDB command timeouts. Helpful for debugging extension

svdFile.description: This is for 'XPERIPHERALS' window provided by 'mcu-debug.peripheral-viewer'.

svdPath.description: This is for 'XPERIPHERALS' window provided by 'mcu-debug.peripheral-viewer' and 'Embedded Tools' Extension from Microsoft.

rttConfig.description: SEGGER's Real Time Trace (RTT) and supported by JLink, OpenOCD and perhaps others in the future

address.description: Address to start searching for the RTT control block.

searchSize.description: Number of bytes to search for the RTT control block.

searchId.description: A string to search for to find the RTT control block.

useBuiltinRTT.description: Use the built-in RTT support (recommended) especially with servers no native RTT support. If false, use gdb-server's RTT support, which may have better performance, but harder to setup.

hostName.description: Host name to use for built-in RTT server.

tcpPort.description: Fixed port number to use for built-in RTT server. If not set, a free port is chosen automatically.

pre_decoder.description: Configuration for an external pre-decoder program to decode RTT channel data before being processed by other decoders.

channels.description: RTT Channels to apply pre-decoder to. If not specified, all channels are used.

args.description: Arguments to pass to pre-decoder program.

cwd.description: Current working directory for pre-decoder program.

env.description: Additional environment variables for pre-decoder program.

polling_interval.description: Only for openocd & builtin RTT handlers. Number of milliseconds (> 0) to wait for check for data on out channels. Setting it lower than 50 may cause issues depending on your probe.

rtt_start_retry.description: Keep trying to start RTT for OpenOCD until it succeeds.

type.description: 'console' with text input/output, 'binary' is for converting byte stream to other data types

prompt.description: Prompt to use for RTT Console

noprompt.description: Don't use a prompt for RTT Console

noclear.description: append to screen/logfile when another connection is made

logfile.description: log all raw data (input and output) to specified file

timestamp.description: Add timestamps while printing for 'console' type.

encoding.description: How binary data bytes are converted into a number.

scale.description: Binary only: This setting will scale the raw value.

encoding.description: This property is only used for binary and graph output formats.

graphId.description: The identifier to use for this data in graph configurations.

scale.description: This setting will scale the raw value.

decoder.description: Path to a javascript module to implement the decoding functionality.

swoConfig.description: Description of SWO can be configured. Also see our Wiki for details

cpuFrequency.description: Target CPU frequency in Hz; 0 will attempt to automatically calculate.

swoPath.description: Path name when source is "file" or "serial".

swoPort.description: When server is "external" && source is "socket", port to connect to.

label.description: A label for the output window.

showOnStartup.description: If true, switches to this output when starting a debug session.

logfile.description: log all raw data to specified file

encoding.description: This property is only used for binary and graph output formats.

label.description: A label for the output window.

scale.description: This setting will scale the raw value.

logfile.description: log all raw data to specified file

encoding.description: This property is only used for binary and graph output formats.

graphId.description: The identifier to use for this data in graph configurations.

scale.description: This setting will scale the raw value.

logfile.description: log all raw data to specified file

decoder.description: Path to a javascript module to implement the decoding functionality.

swoFrequency.description: SWO frequency in Hz; 0 will attempt to automatically calculate.

swoEncoding.description: BMP only: SWO encoding data used at the line level.

ipAddress.description: IP Address for networked J-Link Adapter

serialNumber.description: J-Link or ST-LINK Serial Number - only needed if multiple J-Links/ST-LINKs are connected to the computer

interface.description: Debug Interface type to use for connections (defaults to SWD) - Used for J-Link, ST-LINK and BMP probes.

jlinkscript.description: J-Link script file - optional input file for customizing J-Link actions.

openOCDLaunchCommands.description: OpenOCD command(s) after configuration files are loaded (-c options)

openOCDPreConfigLaunchCommands.description: OpenOCD command(s) before configuration files are loaded (-c options)

configFiles.description: OpenOCD/PE GDB Server configuration file(s) to use when debugging (OpenOCD -f option)

searchDir.description: OpenOCD directories to search for config files and scripts (-s option).

v1.description: For st-util only. Set this to true if your debug probe is a ST-Link V1.

stm32cubeprogrammer.description: This path is normally resolved to the installed STM32CubeIDE or STM32CubeProgrammer but can be overridden here.

targetId.description: On BMP this is the ID number that should be passed to the attach command (defaults to 1); for PyOCD this is the target identifier

boardId.description: PyOCD Board Identifier. Needed if multiple compatible boards are connected.

cmsisPack.description: Path to a CMSIS-Pack file. Use to add extra device support.

BMPGDBSerialPort.description: The serial port for the Black Magic Probe GDB Server.

powerOverBMP.description: Power up the board over Black Magic Probe.

servertype.description: GDB Server type - supported types are jlink, openocd, pyocd, pe, stlink, stutil, qemu, bmp and external. For "external", [please read our Wiki](https://github.com/mcu-debug/mcu-debug/wiki/External-gdb-server-configuration). The executable in your PATH is used by default, to override this use serverpath.

debuggerArgs.description: Additional arguments to pass to GDB command line

preLaunchCommands.description: Additional GDB Commands to be executed at the start of the main launch sequence (immediately after attaching to target).

postLaunchCommands.description: Additional GDB Commands to be executed after the main launch sequence has finished.

preAttachCommands.description: Additional GDB Commands to be executed at the start of the main attach sequence (immediately after attaching to target).

postAttachCommands.description: Additional GDB Commands to be executed after the main attach sequence has finished.

postResetCommands.description: Commands to be executed after a Reset operation, after the reset is sent to the target.

overrideAttachCommands.description: Override the commands that are normally executed as part of attaching to a running target.

overrideResetCommands.description: Override the commands that are normally executed as part of reset-ing the target.

postRestartSessionCommands.description: Deprecated: Restart is now handled by VSCode and it is the same as Start. If you are using the Reset button, use postResetSessionCommands instead

openOCDLaunchCommands.description: OpenOCD command(s) after configuration files are loaded (-c options)

openOCDPreConfigLaunchCommands.description: OpenOCD command(s) before configuration files are loaded (-c options)

configFiles.description: OpenOCD/PE GDB Server configuration file(s) to use when debugging (OpenOCD -f option)

searchDir.description: OpenOCD directories to search for config files and scripts (-s option).

v1.description: For st-util only. Set this to true if your debug probe is a ST-Link V1.

stm32cubeprogrammer.description: This path is normally resolved to the installed STM32CubeIDE or STM32CubeProgrammer but can be overridden here.

targetId.description: On BMP this is the ID number that should be passed to the attach command (defaults to 1); for PyOCD this is the target identifier

boardId.description: PyOCD Board Identifier. Needed if multiple compatible boards are connected.

cmsisPack.description: Path to a CMSIS-Pack file. Use to add extra device support.

BMPGDBSerialPort.description: The serial port for the Black Magic Probe GDB Server.

powerOverBMP.description: Power up the board over Black Magic Probe.

configurationSnippets.label: MCU Debug: JLink
configurationSnippets.description: Debugs an embedded ARM Cortex-M microcontroller using GDB + JLink

configurationSnippets.label: MCU Debug: OpenOCD
configurationSnippets.description: Debugs an embedded ARM Cortex-M microcontroller using GDB + OpenOCD

configurationSnippets.label: MCU Debug: ST-LINK
configurationSnippets.description: Debugs an embedded ARM Cortex-M microcontroller using GDB + STMicroelectronic's ST-LINK_gdbserver part of STM32CubeIDE

configurationSnippets.label: MCU Debug: PyOCD
configurationSnippets.description: Debugs an embedded ARM Cortex-M microcontroller using GDB + PyOCD

configurationSnippets.label: MCU Debug: ST-Link
configurationSnippets.description: Debugs an embedded ARM Cortex-M microcontroller using GDB + Texane's stlink GDB Server

view/title.when: view == workbench.debug.variablesView && inDebugMode && debugType == 'mcu-debug' && debugState == stopped &&  mcu-debug:variableUseNaturalFormat
view == workbench.debug.variablesView && inDebugMode && debugType == 'mcu-debug' && debugState == stopped && !mcu-debug:variableUseNaturalFormat
view == workbench.debug.watchExpressionsView && inDebugMode && debugType == 'mcu-debug' && debugState == stopped &&  mcu-debug:variableUseNaturalFormat
view == workbench.debug.watchExpressionsView && inDebugMode && debugType == 'mcu-debug' && debugState == stopped && !mcu-debug:variableUseNaturalFormat
view == mcu-debug.liveWatch && inDebugMode && debugType == 'mcu-debug' && debugState == stopped &&  mcu-debug:variableUseNaturalFormat
view == mcu-debug.liveWatch && inDebugMode && debugType == 'mcu-debug' && debugState == stopped && !mcu-debug:variableUseNaturalFormat

scripts.compile: npm run build-rust-dev && npm run copy-codicons && npm run generate-manifest && npm run update-commit-hash && npm run check-types && node esbuild.js
scripts.build-all: npm run build-rust-prod && node scripts/generate-ignore-files.js && npm run generate-manifest && npm run update-commit-hash && npm run check-types && node esbuild.js --production
